title: Baked Polenta with Fresh Tomatoes and Parmesan

Ingredients.7: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.8: 1 tablespoon butter, chilled and cut into pieces

Directions.1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking dish.

Directions.2: Place the water, milk, and butter in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the polenta and stir with a wooden spoon until thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup Parmesan cheese and 2 chopped basil leaves; season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer the polenta to the prepared baking dish and arrange the remaining chilled pieces of butter over the top.

Directions.3: Bake the polenta in the preheated oven until bubbly and beginning to brown, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the oven.

Directions.4: Decoratively arrange the slices of tomato over the top of the polenta, spread the remaining basil leaves over the tomatoes, and sprinkle with 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese.

Directions.5: Return to the oven and bake until the tomatoes are warm and the Parmesan cheese is bubbly, 5 to 10 minutes.
